1
rasgo  = feature
pecas = freckles
pelirrojo = redhead
imparcial = impartial, unbiased
carcajada = laugh
soltar = to release
soltar una carcajada = to laugh out loud
veranear = to spend summer
de hecho = in fact
2
brisa = breeze
correr = to blow
radiente = beaming
huésped = guest/host

socorrista = life guard
abrazo = hug
echar de menos = to miss
echar una mano = to help
tener ganas de +inf, que + subj = to want
3
sugerencia = suggestion
buceo = diving
¡qué ilusión + inf! = it’s exciting to ..!
hacer turismo = to travel
agradecer = to thank
avena = oat
tortas de avena = oat cakes
galletas de mantequilla = shortbread cookies
meterse entre ceja y ceja + inf = someone sticks very stubbornly to smth
se le ha metido entre ceja y ceja hacerlo = he’s taken it into his head to do it
4
emocionante = exciting, thrilling
multa de aparcamiento = parking fine
más contento que unas pascuas = extremely happy

viñedo = vineyard

añada = vintage

eufórico = euphoric, exuberant
rojizo = reddish
embarcadero = pier
hablar de lo divino y de lo mundano = to talk about everything
escoger = to choose, pick
aún = still
un día es un día = we live only once
brindar por algo/alguien = to toast
un brindis (por algo) = a toast
¡brindemos! = let’s toast!
5
ratito = little while
nadador = swimmer
salvar = to save
curar = to cure, treat
picadura = bite, sting
en cargo = in charge

nunca te irás a la cama sin saber algo nuevo = you learn smth new everyday

aventura = adventure
tengo una propuesta que hacer = I have a suggestion to make
mándame un mensaje al móvil = send me a message
me apetece estar en la calle = I feel like being outside
6
no pasarse de moda = to not go out of fashion

de alguna manera = in some way, somehow
cortado = coffee served in a small cup to which a little milk is added

buceo a pulmón = free diving

arpón = harpoon
pescador = fisherman
aguantar = to endure
convertirse = to turn, to become
hacerse = to get, to become
seguro que le hará ilusión + inf = he will be very happy to + inf
me hace mucha ilusión saber que él viene = I’m very happy to know that he is coming 
me hace mucha ilusión que él venga = I’m very pleased that he is coming

basta de = enough of
No me lo puedo creer! = I can’t believe it!
